Adrian Goh Jun Wei, Product at NodeflairLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 23 Sep 2018It is actually pretty useful (assuming you meant recruiters reaching out)​Worked with recruiters (both HR and external recruiters) a couple of times and personally used LinkedIn Recruiter, so here's my experience to help you stand out in searches and reached out by recruiters more often!​TLDR: Recruiters search by companies and keywords, so do ensure you include them​How to come out in recruiters' search:​1) Make sure you have a conventional title for your job titles. If you are a software engineer, add 'Software Engineer' instead of 'Java Software Engineer'. 'Coding Ninja' won't turn up in recruiters' search (think of it as Google)​2) Include proper keywords in your Skills. If you specialise in Market Research, include it! If you are great at Online Marketing, include it!​How to have your profiles stand out:​1) Have a good profile picture! Having a selfie/ blurry image as your profile picture gives a poor first impression! Also, don't forget to SMILE! :D​2) Be SUCCINCT when describing your experience! You don't want to list a whole paragraph on your role when it can be done in 2-3 point forms. Recruiters are humans too, help them help you!​3) List impactful outcomes of your work! Instead of saying 'Developed a mobile app', say 'Developed a mobile app with 100k downloads and improves user base by 25% in 3 months' (but make sure it is true!)​4) To truly stand out, write a good summary. Give a quick summary of your career, your specialties and passion!​Hope this help! :)​0 comments1
